description: CubiCal is a suite of fast radio interferometric calibration routines exploiting complex optimisation.

parameters.info: Name of measurement set (MS)
parameters.name: data-ms

parameters.info: Name of MS column to read for data.
parameters.name: data-column

parameters.info:
Chunk data up by this number of timeslots. This limits the amount of data
processed at once. Smaller chunks allow for a smaller RAM footprint and
greater parallelism, but this sets an upper limit on the solution intervals
that may be employed. 0 means use full time axis.
parameters.name: data-time-chunk

parameters.info:
Chunk data by this number of channels. See time-chunk for info.
0 means full frequency axis.
parameters.name: data-freq-chunk

parameters.info:
If set, then time chunks will be broken up whenever the value in the named
column(s) jumps by >JUMPSIZE. Multiple column names may be given, separated
by commas. Use None to disable.
parameters.name: data-chunk-by

parameters.info:
The jump size used in conjunction with chunk-by. If 0, then any change in
value is a jump. If n, then the change must be >n.
parameters.name: data-chunk-by-jump

parameters.info:
If set, processes just one chunk of data matching the chunk ID. Useful for
debugging.
parameters.name: data-single-chunk

parameters.info: FIELD_ID to read from the MS.
parameters.name: sel-field

parameters.info:
DATA_DESC_IDs to read from the MS. Default reads all. Can be specified as
e.g. "5", "5,6,7", "5~7" (inclusive range), "5:8" (exclusive range),
"5:" (from 5 to last).
parameters.name: sel-ddid

parameters.info: Additional TaQL selection string. Combined with other selection options.
parameters.name: sel-taql

parameters.info:
Channels to read (within each DDID). Default reads all. Can be specified as
e.g. "5", "10~20" (10 to 20 inclusive), "10:21" (same), "10:" (from 10 to
end), ":10" (0 to 9 inclusive), "~9" (same).
parameters.name: sel-chan

parameters.info: Predict model visibilities from given LSM (using Montblanc).
parameters.name: model-list

parameters.info:
Enable direction-dependent models. If 'auto', this is determined
by --sol-jones and --model-list, otherwise, enable/disable
explicitly.
parameters.name: model-ddes

parameters.info:
Apply beams if specified eg. 'beam_$(corr)_$(reim).fits' or
'beam_$(CORR)_$(REIM).fits'
parameters.name: model-beam-pattern

parameters.info: Beam l axis
parameters.name: model-beam-l-axis

parameters.info: Beam m axis
parameters.name: model-beam-m-axis

parameters.info: Use CPU or GPU for simulation.
parameters.name: montblanc-device-type

parameters.info: Precision for simulation.
parameters.name: montblanc-dtype

parameters.info: Simulate using linear or circular feeds.
parameters.name: montblanc-feed-type

parameters.info: Memory budget in MB for simulation.
parameters.name: montblanc-mem-budget

parameters.info: verbosity level of Montblanc's console output
parameters.name: montblanc-verbosity

parameters.info:
Column to read weights from. Weights are applied by default. Specify an
empty string to disable.
parameters.name: weight-column

parameters.info:
Which flagsets will be applied prior to calibration. 
Use "-FLAGSET" to apply everything except the named flagset ("-cubical" is
useful, to ignore the flags of a previous CubiCal run).
parameters.name: flags-apply

parameters.info:
Insert BITFLAG column if it is missing, and initialize a named flagset
from FLAG/FLAG_ROW.
parameters.name: flags-auto-init

parameters.info: Save flags to named flagset in BITFLAG. If none or 0, will not save.
parameters.name: flags-save

parameters.info:
If true, reninitializes BITFLAG column from scratch. Useful if you ended up
with a dead one.
parameters.name: flags-reinit-bitflags

parameters.info:
If True, will do an extra round of flagging at the end  (post-solution)
based on solutions statistics, as per the following options.
parameters.name: flags-post-sol

parameters.info:
Intervals with chi-squared values larger than this value times the median
will be flagged.
parameters.name: flags-tf-chisq-median

parameters.info:
Minimum percentage of unflagged visibilities per time/frequncy slot
required to prevent flagging.
parameters.name: flags-tf-np-median

parameters.info:
Minimum percentage of unflagged visibilities along the time axis required
to prevent flagging.
parameters.name: flags-time-density

parameters.info:
Minimum percentage of unflagged visibilities along the frequency axis
required to prevent flagging.
parameters.name: flags-chan-density

parameters.info:
Minimum percentage of unflagged visibilities along the DDID axis
required to prevent flagging.
parameters.name: flags-ddid-density

parameters.info: Enable Mad Max flagging in the solver. This computes the median absolute residual (i.e. median absolute deviation from zero), and flags visibilities exceeding the thresholds
parameters.name: madmax-enable

parameters.info: MAD estimation mode. Use 'corr' for a separate estimate per each baseline and correlation. Otherwise, a single estimate per baseline is computed using 'all' correlations, or only the 'diag' or 'offdiag' correlations.
parameters.name: madmax-estimate

parameters.info: Enable plots for Mad Max flagging. Use 'show' to show figures interactively. Plots will show the worst flagged baseline, and a median flagged baseline, provided the fraction of flagged visibilities is above --flags-mad-plot-thr.
parameters.name: madmax-plot

parameters.info: Threshold (in terms of fraction of visibilities flagged) above which plots will be generated.
parameters.name: madmax-plot-frac-above

parameters.info: Flag on on-diagonal (parallel-hand) residuals
parameters.name: madmax-diag

parameters.info: Flag on off-diagonal (cross-hand) residuals
parameters.name: madmax-offdiag

parameters.info: Threshold for global median MAD (MMAD) flagging. MMAD is computed as the median of the per-baseline MADs. Residuals exceeding S*MMAD/1.428 will be flagged. Can be specified
parameters.name: madmax-global-threshold

parameters.info: Threshold for MAD flagging per baseline (specified in sigmas). Residuals exceeding mad-thr*MAD/1.428 will be flagged. MAD is computed per baseline. This can be specified as a list e.g. N1,N2,N3,... The first value is used to flag residuals before a solution starts (use 0 to disable), the next value is used when the residuals are first recomputed during the solution several iteratins later (see -chi-int), etc. A final pass may be done at the end of the solution. The last value in the list is reused if necessary. Using a list with gradually decreasing values may be sensible. #metavar:SIGMAS
parameters.name: madmax-threshold

parameters.info:
Comma-separated list of Jones terms to enable, e.g. "G,B,dE"
(default: G)
parameters.name: sol-jones

parameters.info: If true, then data, model and gains are taken to be diagonal. Off-diagonal terms in data and model are ignored. This option is then enforced on all Jones terms.
parameters.name: sol-diag-diag

parameters.info: Solve in single or double precision
parameters.name: sol-precision

parameters.info:
Theshold for gain accuracy - gains which improve by less than this value
are considered converged.
parameters.name: sol-delta-g

parameters.info:
Theshold for solution stagnancy - if the chi-squared is improving by less
than this value, the gain is considered stalled.
parameters.name: sol-delta-chi

parameters.info:
Number of iterations to perform between chi-suqared checks. This is done to
avoid computing the expensive chi-squared test evey iteration.
parameters.name: sol-chi-int

parameters.info:
Re-estimate chi-squred and noise at the end of a solution cycle. Disabling
last rites can save a bit of time, but makes the post-solution stats less
informative.
parameters.name: sol-last-rites

parameters.info:
Minimum percentage of solutions which must have stalled before terminating
the solver.
parameters.name: sol-stall-quorum

parameters.info:
Number of iterations per Jones term. If empty, then each Jones
term is solved for once, up to convergence, or up to its -max-iter
setting.
Otherwise, set to a list giving the number of iterations per Jones term.
For example, given two Jones terms and --sol-num-iter 10,20,10, it will
do 10 iterations on the first term, 20 on the second, and 10 again on the
first.
parameters.name: sol-term-iters

parameters.info: Min baseline length to solve for
parameters.name: sol-min-bl

parameters.info: Max baseline length to solve for. If 0, no maximum is applied.
parameters.name: sol-max-bl

parameters.info:
Additional subset of data to actually solve for. Any TaQL string may be
used.
parameters.name: sol-subset

parameters.info:
Load and apply BBCs computed in a previous run. Apply with care! This will
tend to suppress all unmodelled flux towards the centre of the field.
parameters.name: bbc-load-from

parameters.info:
Compute full 2x2 BBCs (as opposed to diagonal-only). Only useful if you
really trust the polarisation information in your sky model.
parameters.name: bbc-compute-2x2

parameters.info:
Apply full 2x2 BBCs (as opposed to diagonal-only). Only enable this if you
really trust the polarisation information in your sky model.
parameters.name: bbc-apply-2x2

parameters.info:
Compute suggested BBCs at end of run,
and save them to the given database. It can be useful to have this always
enabled, since the BBCs provide useful diagnostics of the solution quality
(and are not actually applied without a load-from setting).
parameters.name: bbc-save-to

parameters.info: Compute BBCs per-channel (else across entire band).
parameters.name: bbc-per-chan

parameters.info: Generate output BBC plots.
parameters.name: bbc-plot

parameters.info: Number of CPUs (processes) to use (0 or 1 disables parallelism).
parameters.name: dist-ncpu

parameters.info: Number of OMP threads to use. 0: determine automatically.
parameters.name: dist-nthread

parameters.info: If empty or None, processes will not be pinned to cores. Otherwise, set to the starting core number, or 'N:K' to start with N and step by K
parameters.name: dist-pin

parameters.info: If not 0, pins the I/O & Montblanc process to a separate core, or cores if --montblanc-threads is specified). Ignored if --dist-pin is not set
parameters.name: dist-pin-io

parameters.info: If set, pins the main process to a separate core. If set to, pins it to the same core as the I/O process, if I/O process is pinned. Ignored if --dist-pin is not set
parameters.name: pin-main

parameters.info:
Minimum number of time/freq data-chunks to load into memory
simultaneously. This number should be divisible by ncpu-1 for optimal
performance.
parameters.name: dist-min-chunks

parameters.info: Base name of output files.
parameters.name: out-name
out-mode

parameters.info: Output MS column name (if applicable).
parameters.name: out-column

parameters.info: If set, model visibilities will be written to the specified column.
parameters.name: out-model-column

parameters.info:
Reinitialize output MS column. Useful if the column is in a half-filled
or corrupt state.
parameters.name: out-reinit-column

parameters.info: Which model to subtract, if generating residuals.
parameters.name: out-subtract-model

parameters.info:
Which model directions to subtract, if generating residuals. ":"
subtracts all. Can also be specified as "N", "N:M", ":N", "N:", "N,M,K".
parameters.name: out-subtract-dirs

parameters.info: Export gaintables to CASA caltable format. Tables are exported to same directory as set for cubical databases
parameters.name: out-casa-gaintables

parameters.info: Generate summary plots.
parameters.name: out-plots

parameters.info: Number of processes
parameters.name: dist-nworker

parameters.info: Log memory usage.
parameters.name: log-memory

parameters.info: Disable progress bars and some console output.
parameters.name: log-boring

parameters.info: Append to log file if it exists.
parameters.name: log-append

parameters.info:
Default console output verbosity level. 
Can either be a single number, or a sequence of "name=level,name=level,..."
assignments.
parameters.name: log-verbose

parameters.info:
Default logfile output verbosity level. 
Can either be a single number, or a sequence of "name=level,name=level,..."
assignments. If None, then this simply follows the console level.
parameters.name: log-file-verbose

parameters.info: Jumps into pdb on error.
parameters.name: debug-pdb

parameters.info:
Throw an error if a visibility amplitude in the results exceeds the given value.
Useful for troubleshooting.
parameters.name: debug-panic-amplitude

parameters.info: Invoke pdb before entering the solver.
parameters.name: debug-stop-before-solver

parameters.info:
Seed random number generator with explicit seed. Useful for reproducibility
of the random-based optimizations (sparsification, etc.).
parameters.name: misc-random-seed

parameters.info:
Parset version number, for migration purposes. Can't be specified on command
line.
parameters.name: misc-parset-version

parameters.info: Determines whether this term is direction dependent. --model-ddes must
parameters.name: g-dd-term

parameters.info: Time solution interval for this term. 0 means use entire chunk.
parameters.name: g-time-int

parameters.info: Frequency solution interval for this term. 0 means use entire chunk.
parameters.name: g-freq-int

parameters.info:
Amplitude clipping - flag solutions with diagonal amplitudes below this
value.
parameters.name: g-clip-low

parameters.info: Amplitude clipping - flag solutions with any amplitudes above this value.
parameters.name: g-clip-high

parameters.info: Number of iterations after which to clip this gain.
parameters.name: g-clip-after

parameters.info: Minimum percentage of converged solutions to accept.
parameters.name: g-conv-quorum

parameters.info: Reference antenna - its phase is guaranteed to be zero.
parameters.name: g-ref-ant

parameters.info:
Set to 0 (and specify -load-from or -xfer-from) to load a non-solvable
term is loaded from disk. Not to be confused with --sol-jones, which
determines the active Jones terms.
parameters.name: g-solvable

parameters.info:
Type of Jones matrix to solve for. Note that if multiple Jones terms are
enabled, then only complex-2x2 is supported.
parameters.name: g-type

parameters.info:
Load solutions from given database. The DB must define solutions
on the same time/frequency grid (i.e. should normally come from
calibrating the same pointing/observation). By default, the Jones
matrix label is used to form up parameter names, but his may be
overridden by adding an explicit "//LABEL" to the database filename.
parameters.name: g-load-from

parameters.info:
Transfer solutions from given database. Similar to -load-from, but
solutions will be interpolated onto the required time/frequency grid,
so they can originate from a different field (e.g. from a calibrator).
parameters.name: g-xfer-from

parameters.info: Save solutions to given database.
parameters.name: g-save-to

parameters.info: For DD terms, makes the listed directions non-solvable.
parameters.name: g-fix-dirs
g-update-type

parameters.info: Flag solution intervals where the prior error estimate is above this value.
parameters.name: g-max-prior-error

parameters.info: Flag solution intervals where the posterior variance estimate is above this value.
parameters.name: g-max-post-error

parameters.info: Maximum number of iterations spent on this term.
parameters.name: g-max-iter

parameters.info:
Flag propagation policy. Determines how flags raised on gains propagate back
into the data. Options are 'never' to never propagate, 'always' to always
propagate, 'default' to only propagate flags from direction-independent gains.
parameters.name: g-prop-flags

parameters.info: Determines whether this term is direction dependent. --model-ddes must
parameters.name: g1-dd-term

parameters.info: Time solution interval for this term. 0 means use entire chunk.
parameters.name: g1-time-int

parameters.info: Frequency solution interval for this term. 0 means use entire chunk.
parameters.name: g1-freq-int

parameters.info:
Amplitude clipping - flag solutions with diagonal amplitudes below this
value.
parameters.name: g1-clip-low

parameters.info: Amplitude clipping - flag solutions with any amplitudes above this value.
parameters.name: g1-clip-high

parameters.info: Number of iterations after which to clip this gain.
parameters.name: g1-clip-after

parameters.info: Minimum percentage of converged solutions to accept.
parameters.name: g1-conv-quorum

parameters.info: Reference antenna - its phase is guaranteed to be zero.
parameters.name: g1-ref-ant

parameters.info:
Set to 0 (and specify -load-from or -xfer-from) to load a non-solvable
term is loaded from disk. Not to be confused with --sol-jones, which

parameters.info:

parameters.info: Save solutions to given database.
parameters.name: g1-save-to

parameters.info: For DD terms, makes the listed directions non-solvable.
parameters.name: g1-fix-dirs
g1-update-type

parameters.info: Flag solution intervals where the prior error estimate is above this value.
parameters.name: g1-max-prior-error

parameters.info: Flag solution intervals where the posterior variance estimate is above this value.
parameters.name: g1-max-post-error

parameters.info: Maximum number of iterations spent on this term.
parameters.name: g1-max-iter

parameters.info:
Flag propagation policy. Determines how flags raised on gains propagate back

parameters.name: g1-prop-flags

parameters.info: Determines whether this term is direction dependent. --model-ddes must

parameters.info: Time solution interval for this term. 0 means use entire chunk.
parameters.name: g2-time-int

parameters.info: Flag solution intervals where the prior error estimate is above this value.
parameters.name: b1-max-prior-error

parameters.info: Flag solution intervals where the posterior variance estimate is above this value.
parameters.name: b1-max-post-error

parameters.info: Maximum number of iterations spent on this term.
parameters.name: b1-max-iter

parameters.info:
Flag propagation policy. Determines how flags raised on gains propagate back
into the data. Options are 'never' to never propagate, 'always' to always
propagate, 'default' to only propagate flags from direction-independent gains.
parameters.name: b1-prop-flags

parameters.info: Determines whether this term is direction dependent. --model-ddes must
parameters.name: b2-dd-term

parameters.info: Time solution interval for this term. 0 means use entire chunk.
parameters.name: b2-time-int

parameters.info: Frequency solution interval for this term. 0 means use entire chunk.
parameters.name: b2-freq-int

parameters.info:
Amplitude clipping - flag solutions with diagonal amplitudes below this
value.
parameters.name: b2-clip-low

parameters.info: Amplitude clipping - flag solutions with any amplitudes above this value.
parameters.name: b2-clip-high

parameters.info: Number of iterations after which to clip this gain.
parameters.name: b2-clip-after

parameters.info: Minimum percentage of converged solutions to accept.
parameters.name: b2-conv-quorum

parameters.info: Reference antenna - its phase is guaranteed to be zero.
parameters.name: b2-ref-ant

parameters.info:
Set to 0 (and specify -load-from or -xfer-from) to load a non-solvable
term is loaded from disk. Not to be confused with --sol-jones, which
determines the active Jones terms.
parameters.name: b2-solvable

parameters.info:
Type of Jones matrix to solve for. Note that if multiple Jones terms are
enabled, then only complex-2x2 is supported.
parameters.name: b2-type

parameters.info:
Load solutions from given database. The DB must define solutions
on the same time/frequency grid (i.e. should normally come from
calibrating the same pointing/observation). By default, the Jones
matrix label is used to form up parameter names, but his may be
overridden by adding an explicit "//LABEL" to the database filename.
parameters.name: b2-load-from

parameters.info:
Transfer solutions from given database. Similar to -load-from, but
solutions will be interpolated onto the required time/frequency grid,
so they can originate from a different field (e.g. from a calibrator).
parameters.name: b2-xfer-from

parameters.info: Save solutions to given database.
parameters.name: b2-save-to

parameters.info: For DD terms, makes the listed directions non-solvable.
parameters.name: b2-fix-dirs
b2-update-type

parameters.info: Flag solution intervals where the prior error estimate is above this value.
